title: Andor, The Mobile Assassin
body:
Andor, The Mobile Assassin

Base Stats
Health: 430 (+44)
Health Regen: 1.3 (+.95)
Mana: None
Range: 150
Attack Damage: 26 (+3)
Attack Speed: 0.938 (+3.5%)
Armor 15 (+3.0)
Magic Resist 20 (+1)
Movement Speed: 360 (+20 (read passive)

Abilities

Passive: Quick Combat
Cooldown: 15 seconds
When out of combat gains 20 movement speed. When entering combat, for the first 7 seconds receives +5% attack speed (+1), +15 attack damage (+2), and a move buff that gives 50 movement speed that decays over 1.5 seconds.

Q - Short Hook
Cooldown: 6 seconds
Damage: 15/30/45/60/75
Damage Scaling: 3 AD for 1 damage
Range: 525
Description: Instantly throws a short hook. Quickly dashes to whatever was hit.

W - Quick Step
Cooldown: 20/18/16/14/12 Seconds
Movement Speed: +50/55/60/65/70
Attack Speed: 20%/20%/25%/25%/30%
Buff Duration: 3/3.25/3.50/3.75/4 Seconds
Effect: If Andor gets any kills while this is active it activates the ability again.
All damage taken while this is active is true damage.
Description: Gains a movement and attack speed buff that decays over the amount of time it has.

E - Dash
Cooldown: 14/13/12/11/10 Seconds
Damage: 5/10/20/30/50
Damage Scale: 2 AD for 1 damage
Range: 600 
Effect: Slows all enemies in the 150 range explosion at the end of the dash for 1.5 seconds for 50% move speed
Description: Is a skillshot dash that dashes to wherever Andor clicks. If dashed over the wall enemies gain sight of him for 1.5 seconds

R - Final Strike 
Cooldown: 300/250/200 Seconds
Damage: 50/100/150/200/250
Damage Scale: 1 AD for 3 damage
Effect: Next basic attack (lasts for 60 seconds if no enemy is hit) 
Takes 5% of total health, than 90% of current health. All lifesteal effects are disabled for 30 seconds. W's attack speed buff is removed, it's movement speed buff halved, and it's cooldown doubled, Short hooks range is halved, cooldown is doubled and passive's movement buff are all also effected during this 30 seconds.

Champion description: Andor is a fragile, extremely mobile champion, capable of dealing high amounts of damage at high risk. Andor requires a very high amount of skill to play.

replies.body:
First regarding his champion. I was very excited to finally see a well laid out concept but it was really disappointing.

I love his passive, it allows for nice trading and isn't as large as a buff. The only thing that I don't like here is the duration, 7 seconds is a very long time in the damage terms of League of Legends. It allows him to trade fairly too well in the early game, invading and counterjunglering would also be fairly too easy.


I also liked his Q, but I found it a bit too strong in terms of utility and too weak in terms of damage. With 40% CDR your enemy is given 3.6 seconds to get up to 525 range away from him, that's equal to some ADC's attack range and bigger than Kassadin's R. With the amount of movement speed from his passive and W allows it to be fairly easy to continuously dashing towards enemies and because his passive allows so much early game trading, it's not fairly hard to get ahead, rush a BOTRK and stick on enemies like glue.

This is the downfall of your concept, just the fact that you put TRUE DAMAGE there was enough to say that you don't know the game too well. It was just disappointing and it wasn't even a huge buff, this is literally one of the weakest abilities in League of Legends in terms of Risk and Reward. You take full damage of everything and you only get some movement speed and attack speed. I'd highly recommend you changing this to bonus damage taken instead of True Damage.

This is where he gets ironic and just disgusting, you have an ability called quick step and dash. Both mean pretty much the same but ironically your W doesn't even do what it's meant to do. You have 2 steroids and 2 gap closers, your E and Q for gap closers and your W and Passive.

No. No. No. No. 90% of Current Health really? You also have 5 levels in an ultimate ability, lord save the queen. 

Either way, check out Adora :D
I dont like the title mainly the part *The mobile assasin* all assasins (ive seen) are mobile even off tanks, sorry just nit picky

so much work put into writing this but its so off. you need to research more of what are the capabilities and plateaus  that each champ have in order for them to be strong and weak, but not too much of either, in most scenarios on the field. he doesnt seem to require skill anyway, in fact this is probably the most unoriginal champion ive ever seen. hook shot, dash and skillshot, yeah i havent seen those abilities 20 million times. you call him a mobile assassin, hes only an assassin because you made him so weak. also, all assassins are mobile, thats what makes them an assassin, they need to get into close range of an enemy that deals a lot of damage/cc and kill/disable them before they can do anything against your team. also also, we dont need another fucking katarina running amuck, how dare you suggest such an abomination as a copy of katarina
